title: Original search homepage and client-side results UI

requirements.summary: Create an original, Google-inspired (but non-identical) search landing page with centered logo, prominent search input, and primary/secondary actions.
acceptanceCriteria: The landing page renders a centered logo, search input, and two action buttons.
All branding is original (no use of the Google wordmark, multicolor logo, or proprietary fonts).
Layout is responsive for mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell with route wiring so the landing page is the default route (e.g., "/").
Implement the search landing page layout: centered generated logo, prominent search input, and two action buttons with original brand styling and English-only text.

Create a reusable search form component used on the homepage (and later on results) with a prominent input and primary/secondary actions. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Input) to keep styling consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new App component entry (and ensure the global CSS import resolves correctly) so the homepage renders as the default view.

requirements.summary: Implement a results page that lists mock-search matches with title, host/URL line, and snippet plus an English empty state.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting a query navigates to a results view and shows a results list.
Each result shows a title, a URL/host line, and a snippet.
If no results match, an empty-state message is shown in English.

file_operations.description: Create a results view that reads the query from the URL, filters a local mock dataset client-side, and renders a results list with title, URL/host line, and snippet plus an English empty state.
Add a local mock dataset of searchable items (title, url/host, snippet, keywords) used by the results page filtering logic; no external search APIs.

Create a presentational component to render the results list and empty-state message. Use shadcn-ui primitives where appropriate (e.g., Card/Separator/Typography classes) without modifying immutable ui files; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register and wire navigation to the results route (e.g., "/search") so the results page is reachable after submitting a query.

requirements.summary: Add core search UX: Enter-to-search, editable/clearable query, and query persisted in the URL for refresh/bookmark.
acceptanceCriteria: Pressing Enter in the input triggers navigation to results.
The query appears in the URL (e.g., as a query string) and is restored on reload.
Users can edit the query on the results page and re-run the search.

file_operations.description: Implement form semantics so Enter submits; add clear/edit support (e.g., a clear control) and emit navigation-friendly submit events. Use shadcn-ui Button/Input if used; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
On submit, navigate to the results route while encoding the query in the URL (query string) so it can be bookmarked/refreshed.
Read the query from the URL on mount/load, populate the search box from it, allow editing, and update the URL when re-running the search (keeping refresh/bookmark behavior).

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive minimalist visual theme across the app that feels search-centric but is clearly not a Google replica; ensure English-only UI text.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent typography and component styling.
The theme is minimalist and search-centric but not an exact replica of Google’s design.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Adjust global CSS variables (colors, radius, base text rendering) to create an original minimalist theme that avoids the exact Google palette while remaining clean and search-centric.
Refine Tailwind theme extensions (e.g., font stack, spacing/radius conventions) to ensure consistent typography and component styling across pages without mimicking Google’s proprietary look.
Apply consistent page-level spacing, typography, and button/input styling using the shared theme; keep all visible text in English and ensure the design is not an exact Google replica.
Apply consistent results typography and spacing (title/link line/snippet hierarchy) using the shared theme; keep all visible text in English.

requirements.summary: Add the provided generated images as static frontend assets and render them as the app logo (homepage and optionally results header).
acceptanceCriteria: The homepage displays the generated logo image.
No image is served via the backend; images are loaded as static frontend assets.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/search-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated wide logo asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/search-logo-wide.dim_1200x300.png.
Render the generated logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/search-logo-wide.dim_1200x300.png (or the square variant where appropriate) in the homepage UI as a static asset.

Optionally render a small generated logo in the results header using frontend/public/assets/generated/search-logo.dim_512x512.png (static asset) while keeping the layout clearly non-identical to Google.
